channel.title: Happy Birthday Davidi2
channel.description:
That's right, it's Davidi2s Birthday today ;D
Happy Birthday my friend. If you were a resident of the greatest nation on Earth, the UK, I would have made you crumpets.

item.title: Happy Birthday Davidi2
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I got a lot of books, 17 seasons of the different star trek series, some cash, and starcraft 2. Was a great dinner!

Thanks everyone for the happy birthdays, now I get to lock my own thread

item.title: Happy Birthday Davidi2
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:37, topic:435493”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=538212.msg3937499#msg3937499 date=1331158181]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=538212.msg3937489#msg3937489 date=1331157858]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=538212.msg3937322#msg3937322 date=1331146495]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=538212.msg3937315#msg3937315 date=1331145919]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=538212.msg3937289#msg3937289 date=1331144088]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=538212.msg3937274#msg3937274 date=1331142569]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=538212.msg3937211#msg3937211 date=1331137759]
You don’t have to know what it means, just say Heil
[/quote]it’s odd… I thought there used to be a “English only rule” but I guess I was wrong
[/quote]This is an English only forum, smarty pants. But there is a difference between speaking a different language in your posts and putting a common phrase from a different language in them.

That’s like saying if someone said "feliz navidad’ in their Christmas posts it should be against the rules.
[/quote]So it is English only? Because I didn’t see it in the rules ( maybe I missed it? ) but even then you would be surprised who doesn’t know what feliz navidad is lol
[/quote]You can’t assume that the only rules that matter are the ones in those topics. In the case of ‘English only’, you wont get infracted for it unless a mod tells you to stop speaking the other language. It usually applies to people that only speak a different language or speak a different language to annoy/exclude people. The majority of people will know what feliz navidad means, as well as sieg heil, mein kampf, bon appetit, etc
[/quote]I only know what feliz navidad means in that entire list lmao… see my point? You can’t use general “common” other language terms and not expect people to ask “what does that mean” that’s like a first time gamer getting on RS hearing somebody call him a “noob” and then getting laughed at/insulted because he doesn’t know what the word noob means.
[/quote]By your logic we should ban people from saying noob then too, or any lingo not normally found in a language. People can easily learn a common new word or two, whereas a whole language (this, whole post in a different language) is a different story.
[/quote]where did I say I would ban them? You do realize the only reason this was brought up was because I asked what a word meant? What does that tell you about the way your acting? How does being profiled feel like?[/quote]Actually it started when you were being a smartass and tried to say I was breaking the rules for using words from another language But thanks for the happy birthday.

Going out to dinner in like 3-4 hrs

EDIT - Oh and thanks everyone else for all the happy birthdays I’ll make sure to post what I got.

Read full topic

item.title: Happy Birthday Davidi2
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:34, topic:435493”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=538212.msg3937489#msg3937489 date=1331157858]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=538212.msg3937322#msg3937322 date=1331146495]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=538212.msg3937315#msg3937315 date=1331145919]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=538212.msg3937289#msg3937289 date=1331144088]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=538212.msg3937274#msg3937274 date=1331142569]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=538212.msg3937211#msg3937211 date=1331137759]
You don’t have to know what it means, just say Heil
[/quote]it’s odd… I thought there used to be a “English only rule” but I guess I was wrong
[/quote]This is an English only forum, smarty pants. But there is a difference between speaking a different language in your posts and putting a common phrase from a different language in them.

That’s like saying if someone said "feliz navidad’ in their Christmas posts it should be against the rules.
[/quote]So it is English only? Because I didn’t see it in the rules ( maybe I missed it? ) but even then you would be surprised who doesn’t know what feliz navidad is lol
[/quote]You can’t assume that the only rules that matter are the ones in those topics. In the case of ‘English only’, you wont get infracted for it unless a mod tells you to stop speaking the other language. It usually applies to people that only speak a different language or speak a different language to annoy/exclude people. The majority of people will know what feliz navidad means, as well as sieg heil, mein kampf, bon appetit, etc
[/quote]I only know what feliz navidad means in that entire list lmao… see my point? You can’t use general “common” other language terms and not expect people to ask “what does that mean” that’s like a first time gamer getting on RS hearing somebody call him a “noob” and then getting laughed at/insulted because he doesn’t know what the word noob means.
[/quote]By your logic we should ban people from saying noob then too, or any lingo not normally found in a language. People can easily learn a common new word or two, whereas a whole language (this, whole post in a different language) is a different story.[/quote]where did I say I would ban them? You do realize the only reason this was brought up was because I asked what a word meant? What does that tell you about the way your acting? How does being profiled feel like?

Happy Birthday either way David I am tired of responded xD

Read full topic

You can’t use general “common” other language terms and not expect people to ask “what does that mean” that’s like a first time gamer getting on RS hearing somebody call him a “noob” and then getting laughed at/insulted because he doesn’t know what the word noob means.[/quote]By your logic we should ban people from saying noob then too, or any lingo not normally found in a language. People can easily learn a common new word or two, whereas a whole language (this, whole post in a different language) is a different story.
